summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case USA v. Ghislaine Maxwell, scheduling her sentencing for June 28, 2022, and outlining the schedule for post-verdict motions and the handling of severed perjury counts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case USA v. Maxwell, for whom a sentencing date is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who signed the order scheduling the sentencing and managing the case schedule.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell and issued the order scheduling her sentencing.

events.title: Maxwell Sentencing Scheduled
events.description: The court schedules the sentencing for Ghislaine Maxwell for June 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signs an order setting the sentencing date and outlining procedures for post-verdict motions and perjury counts.

events.title: Government Deadline for Speedy Trial Act
events.description: The government is ordered to indicate by this date whether it seeks an exclusion of time under the Speedy Trial Act for the severed perjury counts.

events.title: Presentence Report Delay
events.description: The court delays ordering the preparation of a presentence investigation report until April 2022.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing in her criminal case was scheduled for June 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m.
The order defers proceedings on severed perjury counts until after post-verdict motions are resolved.
The government was required to indicate by January 18, 2022, if it sought a Speedy Trial Act exclusion for the perjury counts.
The preparation of a presentence investigation report was delayed until April 2022.
The order references a joint letter from the parties (Docket No. 574) and a prior schedule for post-verdict motions (Docket No. 571).
